title: Drawing, "Catafalque of the Bolgonese Artist Elisabetta Sirani (1638-1665)", 1665
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over red chalk on off-white laid paper
inscribed: Printed in an escutchon over the front: HIC TERMINUS / ERET. Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper right: Tempio del Honore rapresentato p [er] alla Sig. Elisabetta Sirani nella Chie [sa].
provenance:
From the collection of Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
ex-collection: Giovanni Piancastelli
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Artist working on canvas in a pavilion with a high dado, which is decorated with escutcheons with winged skulls. A pair of mermen holding candles flank the flight of stairs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Catafalque of the Bolgonese Artist Elisabetta Sirani (1638-1665)", 1665.
1665. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over red chalk on off-white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2503.
